p.s: Parascardovia (Pa.ra.scar.do'vi.a. N.L. fem. n. Parascardovia resembling Scardovia)
Small, slender rods of variable shape.
The fermentation products from glucose are L-(+Â­)-lactic acid and acetic acid at a molar ratio of 1:2.
The G+C content of the DNA of the type species of this genus is 55.1 mol%.
According to 16S rRNA analysis and HSP60 genesequence analysis, Parascardovia represents a new genus belonging to the family Bifidobacteriaceae.
Only one species, the type species Parascardovia denticolens comb. nov., has been described.
